About Netskope
Today, there's more data and users outside the enterprise than inside, causing the network perimeter as we know it to dissolve. We realized a new perimeter was needed, one that is built in the cloud and follows and protects data wherever it goes, so we started Netskope to redefine Cloud, Network and Data Security. 
Since 2012, we have built the market-leading cloud security company and an award-winning culture powered by hundreds of employees spread across offices in Santa Clara, San Francisco, Seattle, Bangalore, London, Melbourne, and Tokyo. Our core values are openness, honesty, and transparency, and we purposely developed our open desk layouts and large meeting spaces to support and promote partnerships, collaboration, and teamwork. From catered lunches and office celebrations to employee recognition events (pre and hopefully post-Covid) and social professional groups such as the Awesome Women of Netskope (AWON), we strive to keep work fun, supportive and interactive.  Visit us at Netskope Careers and follow us on Twitter @Netskope and Facebook. 
In this role, you will be working as part of the Technical Support Operations(TSO) Group. This group is responsible for improving the efficiency of the Global Technical Support Team.
Responsibilities

Implement new tools and integrations to help improve the support team’s efficiency
Instrument & Build Monitoring Dashboards for customers using SumoLogic
Build a front-end that provides a quick view into the status of all the backend systems and allows additional drill down as needed for troubleshooting. This requires building API integration with all the backend tools such as Zabbix, Nagios, Home-grown tools. 
Develop custom scripts for customers
Investigation of  Next-generation support tools 
Collaborate with the support management team to identify opportunities, identify short and long-term solutions. 
API Integration with business tools used by other teams  (Salesforce, Gainsight, Slack, JIRA)  
Enhancement of the Netskope support portal experience


Required Experience and Skills:

Strong passion for solving practical business problems
Prior experience working with Sumologic, Opsgenie
Interest in learning new technologies and programming languages
Prior experience in any of the following programming languages:

Ruby on rails
Python
Java
C/C++
PHP
Javascript: jQuery, D3, highcharts

Not necessary, but extra bonus points for dabbling in elixir, erlang or rust

Education:

Bachelors or Masters degree
